text: The Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic,; , Estonskaya Sovetskaya Sotsalisticheskaya Respublika or Estonian SSR or ESSR, was a republic of the Soviet Union. It was administered by and subordinated to the Government of the Soviet Union. The ESSR replaced the Republic of Estonia on 21 July 1940, after the invasion of Soviet troops on 17 June 1940. A puppet government backed by the Soviet Union, declared Estonia to be a Soviet state. The Estonian SSR was taken into the USSR on 9 August 1940. The independence of the Republic of Estonia was reestablished on 20 August 1991. == Notes == Category:Establishments in Estonia Category:1940 establishments in Europe Category:1940s disestablishments Category:1944 establishments in the Soviet Union Category:1991 disestablishments in the Soviet Union Category:1940s establishments in Europe Category:Republics of the Soviet Union Category:States and territories disestablished in the 1990s
title: Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic
